author: Anam Rabbani
text:
The spirit of philosophy is one of free inquiry. It suspects all authority. 
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
عقل لرزاں از اجل و آں عشق شوخ 
Reason is trembling with fear of death but love is bold
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Civilization is a thought of the powerful man.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Power toucheth Falsehood, and lo! it is transformed into 
Truth.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/NDGRSY4fTH

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
The powerful man creates environment; the feeble have to 
adjust themselves to it. 
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/YIr5buBl38

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Ideas act and react on each other. The growing spirit of 
individualism in politics is not without its influence on 
contemporary scientific thought. Modern thought regards 
the universe a democracy of living atoms.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/m3Lis4lisx

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Philosophy is the logic of right, history the logic of might. 
The cannons of this later logic appear to be more sound 
than those of her sister logic.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/24Is2jswuv

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Justice is an inestimable treasure; but we must guard it 
against the thief of mercy.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/q4Zopsrpb1

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
It is idle to seek logical truth in poetry. The ideal of 
imagination is beauty, not truth. Do not then try to show a 
poet’s greatness by quoting passages from his works 
which, in your opinion, embody scientific truth.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/U8FsiCnp1s

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
“Let fools fight for the forms of government,” says 
Alexander Pope. I cannot agree with this political philosophy. To my mind,government,whatever its form, 
is one of the determining forces of a people’s character.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
The Power of Belief 
Belief is a great power. When I see that a proposition of 
mine is believed by another mind, my own conviction of 
its truth is thereby immensely increased.
(Stray Reflections, 1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/yAFUoMzPkN

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Heart – “It is absolutely certain that God does exist.” 
Head – “But, my dear boy! Existence is one of my 
categories, and you have no right to use it.” 
Heart – “So much the better, my Aristotle!”
(Stray Reflections, 1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/1JtKOz8aJI

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Human intellect is nature’s attempt at self-criticism.
(Stray Reflections, 1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought
#Iqbalsdeathanniversary https://t.co/aMSR8YuTe0

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Our Soul discovers itself when we come into contact with 
a great mind. It is not until I had realised the Infinitude of 
Goethe’s imagination that I discovered the narrow breadth 
of my own."- Allama Iqbal
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/nak7ijySi4

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Art is a sacred lie.
(Stray Reflections, 1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought https://t.co/LI58GZ96q2

author: Anam Rabbani
text:
Given character and healthy imagination, 
it is possible to reconstruct this world 
of sin and misery 
into a veritable paradise.
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought

author: Anam Rabbani
Anam Rabbani
text:
For centuries Eastern heart and intellect 
have been absorbed in the question – 
Does God exist? 
I propose to raise a new question 
– new, that is to say, for the East – 
Does man exist?
(Stray Reflections,1910)
#GlimpseofIqbalsthought
